title: EVE Fanfest 2025 Kicks off Today
description: EVE Fanfest is already in progress as the game readies to hit its 22nd year tomorrow. Actually, things in Iceland started earlier this week as CCP hosted an EVE Frontier hackathon, a not too subtle effort to get free labor to flesh out their blockchain scam game.  Honestly, it doesn’t matter what they do or […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: EVE Fanfest is already in progress as the game readies to hit its 22nd year tomorrow. Actually, things in Iceland started earlier this week as CCP hosted an EVE Frontier hackathon, a not too subtle…
text: EVE Fanfest is already in progress as the game readies to hit its 22nd year tomorrow. EVE Fanfest 2025 Actually, things in Iceland started earlier this week as CCP hosted an EVE Frontier hackathon, a not too subtle effort to get free labor to flesh out their blockchain scam game.  Honestly, it doesn’t matter what they do or how much help they get, the internal inconsistencies of their plan has doomed the game. And Fanfest itself started rolling yesterday with registration, welcome events, and some player presentations to keep people busy before the real event begins.  I know, if you’re a presenter you want to feel like you’re part of the plan.  But if you’re not on the streaming schedule… well, I’ve been there as a marginalized presenter too. Here is what those of us viewing from home will have access to. EVE Fanfest 2025 – Streaming Schedule Today there are a host of things happening, a lot more than are on the streaming schedule and many of which will be going on while I am asleep here on the west coast of the US.  Time zones will do that to you.  And even after I am awake I have a busy day at the office so I won’t be watching any of it live.  I hope they have things available to replay in an easy fashion. (The tradition is “here’s 8 hours of video, figure out it out yourself.”) So here is the Friday schedule. EVE Fanfest 2025 – Friday Schedule The EVE Keynote will be the key item for me on day one.  Once we get through the first half, which is inevitably just CCP endlessly congratulating itself on the great job it believes it has done on literally everything, we will eventually get to some information that will act as a guide as to what to expect for the rest of 2025. For EVE Online players, the meat of the presentations will be around the upcoming expansion.  I expect that will be announced at the keynote, but the dive into what it means won’t come around until Saturday. EVE Fanfest 2025 – Saturday Schedule On Saturday we will get the expansion keynote… everybody gets a keynote at some point, to the extent that I worry that the main keynote will be completely devoid of value… and two panels about the expansion before heading straight to the closing ceremony.  It is almost as if they don’t want players hanging about asking awkward questions. As a resident of null sec, I remember last year’s expansion announcement being somewhat vague plans to make the region more dynamic and, after four months of figuring out exactly what to do, CCP had to finally wrap up changes to work on the next expansion and null sec empires were left even more tied to their space and unlikely to go to war than before. We shall see.  I would like my gloomy outlook to be proven wrong. Anyway, off we go.  There are far more details available in the CCP post below. Related: CCP – EVE Fanfest 2025 Megablog CCP – EVE Fanfest 2025 – Join us on the Live Stream
html:
EVE Fanfest is already in progress as the game readies to hit its 22nd year tomorrow.

EVE Fanfest 2025

Actually, things in Iceland started earlier this week as CCP hosted an EVE Frontier hackathon, a not too subtle effort to get free labor to flesh out their blockchain scam game.  Honestly, it doesn’t matter what they do or how much help they get, the internal inconsistencies of their plan has doomed the game.

And Fanfest itself started rolling yesterday with registration, welcome events, and some player presentations to keep people busy before the real event begins.  I know, if you’re a presenter you want to feel like you’re part of the plan.  But if you’re not on the streaming schedule… well, I’ve been there as a marginalized presenter too.

Here is what those of us viewing from home will have access to.

EVE Fanfest 2025 – Streaming Schedule

Today there are a host of things happening, a lot more than are on the streaming schedule and many of which will be going on while I am asleep here on the west coast of the US.  Time zones will do that to you.  And even after I am awake I have a busy day at the office so I won’t be watching any of it live.  I hope they have things available to replay in an easy fashion. (The tradition is “here’s 8 hours of video, figure out it out yourself.”)

So here is the Friday schedule.

EVE Fanfest 2025 – Friday Schedule

The EVE Keynote will be the key item for me on day one.  Once we get through the first half, which is inevitably just CCP endlessly congratulating itself on the great job it believes it has done on literally everything, we will eventually get to some information that will act as a guide as to what to expect for the rest of 2025.

For EVE Online players, the meat of the presentations will be around the upcoming expansion.  I expect that will be announced at the keynote, but the dive into what it means won’t come around until Saturday.

EVE Fanfest 2025 – Saturday Schedule

On Saturday we will get the expansion keynote… everybody gets a keynote at some point, to the extent that I worry that the main keynote will be completely devoid of value… and two panels about the expansion before heading straight to the closing ceremony.  It is almost as if they don’t want players hanging about asking awkward questions.

As a resident of null sec, I remember last year’s expansion announcement being somewhat vague plans to make the region more dynamic and, after four months of figuring out exactly what to do, CCP had to finally wrap up changes to work on the next expansion and null sec empires were left even more tied to their space and unlikely to go to war than before.

We shall see.  I would like my gloomy outlook to be proven wrong.

Anyway, off we go.  There are far more details available in the CCP post below.

Related:

  • CCP – EVE Fanfest 2025 Megablog
  • CCP – EVE Fanfest 2025 – Join us on the Live Stream
